indicator_01.description: This indicates the funds available as opening balance under the scheme
indicator_01.name: Opening Balance
indicator_01.note: Opening balance under the scheme is reported here as on 1 April of each Financial Year

indicator_02.description: This shows central share of funds allocated for the scheme
indicator_02.name: Funds Allocation by Government of India
indicator_02.note: As per the information available in the scheme website

indicator_03.description: This is the amount of funds released by the Government of India for the scheme
indicator_03.name: Funds Released by Government of India
indicator_03.note: As per the information available in the scheme website

indicator_04.description: Total funds available as central share for the scheme is the addition of opening balance and funds released by Government of India
indicator_04.name: Total Funds Available (Central Share)
indicator_04.note: As per the information available in the scheme website

indicator_05.description: This indicates the amount of funds spent under the scheme out of Central Government share
indicator_05.name: Expenditure of Central Government Share
indicator_05.note: As per the information available in the scheme website

indicator_06.description: This indicates the amount of expenditure reported under the scheme out of state share
indicator_06.name: Expenditure of State Government Share
indicator_06.note: As per the information available in the scheme website

indicator_07.description: Interest accrued under the designated bank accounts of the scheme
indicator_07.name: Bank Interest Accrued
indicator_07.note: As per the information available in the scheme website

indicator_08.description: This indicates any other deposit / recoveries made under the scheme during the FY
indicator_08.name: Other Deposits / Recoveries
indicator_08.note: As per the information available in the scheme website

indicator_09.description: This shows total expenditure made under the scheme including state share
indicator_09.name: Total Expenditure (Government of India and State Share)
indicator_09.note: As per the information available in the scheme website

indicator_10.description: It shows the extent of funds utilised out of the total funds available (only central share)
indicator_10.name: Extent of Funds Utilised against Total Funds Available (Central Share)
indicator_10.note: This has been computed by taking Total Funds Utilised upon Total Funds released multiplied by 100

metadata.description: The NRDWP / Jal Jeevan Mission is a central government initiative under the Ministry of Jal Shakti. JJM aims to provide safe and adequate drinking water to all households in rural India through individual household tap connections by 2024.
metadata.name: National Rural Drinking Water Programme (NRDWP) / Jal Jeevan Mission (JJM)
metadata.source: Compiled by CBGA from the data available at https://ejalshakti.gov.in/IMISReports/Reports/Financial/rpt_RWS_StatewiseAllocationReleaseExpenditure_S.aspx?Rep=0&RP=Y

indicator_01.description: Total funds approved for the scheme / component
indicator_01.name: Supplementary Nutrition Programme (SNP) – Total Funds  Approved
indicator_01.note: As per the information provided in the Annual Programme Implementation Plan (APIP)

indicator_02.description: Total funds released by the Government of India (as its share) based on the fund sharing agreement on the scheme / component
indicator_02.name: Supplementary Nutrition Programme (SNP) – Total Funds Released
indicator_02.note: Funds released out of approved allocation after adjusting unspent balances / excess expenditure incurred by the States/UTs in the previous financial year.

indicator_03.description: The negative figures reported under funds utilised indicate unspent balance available with  the States / UTs, if any
indicator_03.name: Supplementary Nutrition Programme (SNP) – Total Funds Utilised
indicator_03.note: Total funds utilised only captures GoI share for the scheme / component and does not include the State's share

indicator_04.description: It shows the extent of funds utilised out of the total funds approved
indicator_04.name: Supplementary Nutrition Programme (SNP) – Extent of Funds Utilised against Total Funds Approved
indicator_04.note: This has been computed by taking Total Funds Utilised upon Total Funds Approved multiplied by 100

indicator_05.description: It shows the extent of funds utilised (Only GoI share) out of the total funds released from the GoI
indicator_05.name: Supplementary Nutrition Programme (SNP) – Extent of Funds Utilised against Total Funds Released
indicator_05.note: This has been computed by taking Total Funds Utilised upon Total Funds Released multiplied by 100

indicator_06.description: Total funds approved for the scheme / component
indicator_06.name: ICDS (General) -  Total Funds Approved
indicator_06.note: As per the information provided in the Annual Programme Implementation Plan (APIP)

indicator_07.description: Total funds released by the Government of India (as its share) based on the fund sharing agreement on the scheme / component
indicator_07.name: ICDS (General) – Total Funds Released
indicator_07.note: Funds released out of approved allocation after adjusting unspent balances / excess expenditure incurred by the States/UTs in the previous financial year.

indicator_08.description: The negative figures reported under funds utilised indicate unspent balance available with  the States / UTs, if any
indicator_08.name: ICDS (General) – Total Funds Utilised
indicator_08.note: Total funds utilised only captures GoI share for the scheme / component and does not include the State's share

indicator_09.description: It shows the extent of funds utilised out of the total funds approved
indicator_09.name: ICDS (General) -  Extent of Funds Utilised against Total Funds Approved
indicator_09.note: This has been computed by taking Total Funds Utilised upon Total Funds Approved multiplied by 100

indicator_10.description: It shows the extent of funds utilised (Only GoI share) out of the total funds released from the GoI
indicator_10.name: ICDS (General) – Extent of Funds Utilised against Total Funds Released
indicator_10.note: This has been computed by taking Total Funds Utilised upon Total Funds Released multiplied by 100

metadata.description: ICDS scheme was launched in 1975. It is one of the world’s largest programmes for the holistic development of the child. The scheme primarily aims at preventing malnutrition and improving child health (aged 0-6).  Simultaneously, mother’s health is given priority under this scheme to ensure her capacity to nurture her child. The importance is laid on early child care and learning environment. The scheme tries to provide community-based locally responsive childcare approaches. It is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme funded by both Centre and State Governments based on the fund sharing agreement
metadata.name: Integrated Child Development Services (ICDS)
metadata.source: Compiled by CBGA from the base data provided in Lok Sabha Unstarred Question

indicator_01.description: Total amount of funds released as central share for the scheme
indicator_01.name: Total Funds Released
indicator_01.note: Data received as per the responses received under RTI

indicator_02.description: This shows the amount of central share utilised under the scheme
indicator_02.name: Total Funds Utilised
indicator_02.note: Data received as per the responses received under RTI

indicator_03.description: The amount of funds that remains unspent under the scheme
indicator_03.name: Unspent Balance
indicator_03.note: Data received as per the responses received under RTI

indicator_04.description: It shows the percentage of funds utilised out of the total funds released
indicator_04.name: Extent of Funds Utilised against Total Funds Released
indicator_04.note: This has been computed by taking Total Funds Utilised upon Total Funds Released multiplied by 100

metadata.description: The  scheme Swadhar Greh (SG) targets the women victims of difficult circumstances who are in need of institutional support for rehabilitation. It is aimed at helping women lead their life with dignity. Provisions under the scheme include providing shelter, food, clothing and health as well as economic and social security for these women. The scheme is implemented by the Ministry of Women and Child Development, Government of India. The scheme provides for setting up Swadhar Grehs in every district with a capacity of 30 women.
metadata.name: Swadhar Greh (SG)
metadata.source: Compiled by CBGA from the responses received under RTI

indicator_01.description: Opening Balance reported for the scheme as on 1 April
indicator_01.name: Opening Balance as on 1 April
indicator_01.note: Data compiled as per the information provided in the Fund Position Report

indicator_02.description: This indicates total funds received from the Government of India (as Central Share)
indicator_02.name: Funds Received from Central Government
indicator_02.note: Data compiled as per the information provided in the Fund Position Report

indicator_03.description: This is the total funds received from the State Government (as States share)
indicator_03.name: Funds Received as State Share
indicator_03.note: Data compiled as per the information provided in the Fund Position Report

indicator_04.description: Other receipts raised for the scheme
indicator_04.name: Other Receipts
indicator_04.note: Data compiled as per the information provided in the Fund Position Report

indicator_05.description: Total funds available is the sum of the opening balance and the funds received from Government of India and State Governments
indicator_05.name: Total Funds Available
indicator_05.note: Data compiled as per the information provided in the Fund Position Report

indicator_06.description: Total expenditure made during the Financial Year
indicator_06.name: Total Expenditure
indicator_06.note: Data compiled as per the information provided in the Fund Position Report

indicator_07.description: This indicates the Net Unspent Balance available at the end of Financial Year
indicator_07.name: Net Unspent Balance Available
indicator_07.note: Data compiled as per the information provided in the Fund Position Report

indicator_08.description: It is showing the extent of Fund Utilised against Total Fund Available for the scheme
indicator_08.name: Extent of Fund Utilised against Total Fund Available
indicator_08.note: This has been computed by taking Total Funds Utilised upon Total Funds Available multiplied by 100

metadata.description: The Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme. This scheme was introduced in 2000 under the Ministry of Rural Development, Government of India. The scheme aims at achieving nationwide all-weather road connectivity to unconnected villages in the country.
metadata.name: Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana (PMGSY)
metadata.source: Compiled by CBGA from the  data provided in Fund Position Report of the Scheme available at:  http://omms.nic.in/

indicator_01.description: Based on the demand from the states / UTs funds are made available by the Union Government for the scheme.
indicator_01.name: Total Fund Available
indicator_01.note: Total fund available includes Opening Balance as per Utilisation Certificate.

indicator_02.description: Total expenditure excludes payment due to wages to labourers, material and admin expenses.
indicator_02.name: Total Expenditure (Excluding Payment Due)
indicator_02.note: Total expenditure includes wage payment to unskilled labourers, payment on materials (which includes the cost for material, wages to semiskilled and skilled labourers and taxes, if any), admin expenses and other expenditures (which includes delay in compensation and unemployment allowances, if any)

indicator_03.description: Actual fund balance is the difference between the total fund available and total expenditure (excluding payment due)
indicator_03.name: Actual Fund Balance
indicator_03.note: The negative fund balance indicates the unspent balance available with the States / UTs

indicator_04.description: The amount is due for payment to labourers, material cost, admin and costs for admin expenses
indicator_04.name: Total Payment Due

indicator_05.description: Total expenditure includes total actual expenditure plus the payments due to be given to labourers, material cost, admin and other costs
indicator_05.name: Total Expenditure (Including Payment Due)

indicator_06.description: The total fund balance is the difference between the total fund available and total expenditure (including payment due).
indicator_06.name: Total Fund Balance (Net)
indicator_06.note: The negative fund balance indicates the unspent balance available with the States / UTs

indicator_07.description: This measures the extent of fund utilised out of the funds available under the scheme
indicator_07.name: Extent of Fund Utilisation
indicator_07.note: This is computed by taking the total fund available upon the total expenditure (including payment due) multiplied by 100. More than 100 per cent fund utilisation indicates negative net fund balance under the scheme budget

metadata.description: MGNREGS aims to enhance livelihood security of the rural masses with a provision of at least 100 days of wage employment in a financial year to every rural household whose adult member volunteers to do unskilled manual work. This is one of the world’s largest public sector employment programmes, providing guaranteed income through employment.
metadata.name: Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Scheme (MGNREGS)
metadata.source: Compiled by CBGA from the data available at: MGNREGA MIS Data https://www.nrega.nic.in/netnrega/mgnrega_new/Nrega_home.aspx

indicator_01.description: Opening Balance is the Spill Over  amount of the previous Financial Year (FY)
indicator_01.name: Opening Balance
indicator_01.note: Data compiled from the information presented in PAB minutes of States

indicator_02.description: Budget approved is the same as Estimated Outlay for the scheme
indicator_02.name: Budget Approved
indicator_02.note: Data compiled from the RTI response

indicator_03.description: Fresh funds released from the Central and State Governments for Recurring components of the scheme
indicator_03.name: Total Allocation (Recurring)
indicator_03.note: Data compiled from the base information presented in PAB minutes of States

indicator_04.description: Fresh funds released from the Central and State Governments for Non-recurring components of the scheme
indicator_04.name: Total Allocation (Non-Recurring)
indicator_04.note: Data compiled from the information presented in PAB minutes of States

indicator_05.description: Total available fund is the sum of the Opening Balance (which is known as Spill Over from the previous FY) and total fresh allocations (Recurring and Non- Non-Recurring)
indicator_05.name: Total Available Fund
indicator_05.note: Data compiled from the information presented in PAB minutes of States

indicator_06.description: Funds released from the Central Government is the Central Government's share for the scheme for both recurring and non-recurring components of the scheme
indicator_06.name: Fund Released from the Central Government
indicator_06.note: Data compiled from the RTI response

indicator_07.description: This shows total amount of expenditure reported by the States / UTs (including State shares)
indicator_07.name: Expenditure Incurred by the States / UTs
indicator_07.note: Data compiled from the RTI response

indicator_08.description: This shows total unspent amount available with the States / UTs
indicator_08.name: Unspent Balance
indicator_08.note: Data compiled from the RTI response. Figures with a negative sign indicates over-spending reported by States / UTs

indicator_09.description: It shows the proportion of fund utilised against the total fund available for the scheme
indicator_09.name: Extent of Fund Utilisation against Total Available Fund
indicator_09.note: This has been computed by taking total expenditure reported upon the total fund available under the scheme multiplied by 100

metadata.description: Samagra Shiksha Abhiyan is an overarching programme for the school education sector extending from pre-school to class XII and is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme. The goal of the programme is to improve school effectiveness, measured in terms of equal opportunities for schooling and equitable learning outcomes. It started implementation in 2018 and subsumes three earlier programmes like Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan (SSA), Rashtriya Madhyamik Shiksha Abhiyan (RMSA) and Teacher Education (TE).
metadata.name: Samagra Shiksha Abhiyan (SmSA)
metadata.source: Compiled by CBGA from the RTI reply received and the data available at https://seshagun.gov.in/pab-minutes?field_pab_no_value=&field_financial_year_target_id=40&field_states_target_id=All

indicator_01.description: This indicates status of funds available under the scheme for multi sectoral intervention in the district
indicator_01.name: Funds Available
indicator_01.note: Compiled by CBGA from the data provided in Lok Sabha unstarred question

indicator_02.description: This indicates the total amount of funds utilised under the scheme
indicator_02.name: Funds Utilised
indicator_02.note: Compiled by CBGA from the data provided in Lok Sabha unstarred question

indicator_03.description: This indicates total amount of funds remained unutilised under the scheme
indicator_03.name: Unspent Balance
indicator_03.note: As per the response received under RTI

indicator_04.description: It shows the extent of funds utilised out of the total funds available under the scheme
indicator_04.name: Extent of Funds Utilised against Funds Available
indicator_04.note: This has been computed by taking Total Funds Utilised upon Total Funds Available multiplied by 100

metadata.description: Beti Bachao Beti Padhao (BBBP) scheme was launched on 22 January, 2015 with an objective to address discrimination against females, in terms of declining child sex ratio. The scheme attempts to address issues of empowerment of girls and women over a life cycle continuum. The scheme is being implemented in all districts of the country.
metadata.name: Beti Bachao Beti Padhao (BBBP)
metadata.source: Compiled by CBGA from the data provided in Lok Sabha unstarred question and response received under RTI

indicator_01.description: Amount reported as balance under the scheme by end of the previous Financial Year (FY)
indicator_01.name: Opening Balance
indicator_01.note: Negative sign in opening balance indicates over expenditure reported in the previous FY. Information compiled based on the minutes of the PAB meetings

indicator_02.description: Total funds allocated for the scheme
indicator_02.name: Total Budget Allocated
indicator_02.note: As per the information provided in the minutes of the PAB meetings

indicator_03.description: Total funds released for the scheme / component
indicator_03.name: Fund Released
indicator_03.note: As per the information provided in the minutes of the PAB meetings

indicator_04.description: Negative sign shows over utilisation of funds during the current FY
indicator_04.name: Total Fund Utilised
indicator_04.note: As per the information provided in the minutes of the PAB meetings

indicator_05.description: This shows the level of under / over utilisation of funds
indicator_05.name: Under / Over Utilisation of Fund
indicator_05.note: Negative signs indicate over utilisation of funds

indicator_06.description: It shows the extent of funds utilised out of the total funds allocated
indicator_06.name: Extent of Fund Utilised Against Budget Allocation
indicator_06.note: This has been computed by taking total fund utilised upon total  budget allocated multiplied by 100

indicator_07.description: It shows the extent of funds utilised out of the total funds released
indicator_07.name: Extent of Fund Utilised Against Fund Released
indicator_07.note: This has been computed by taking total funds utilised upon total funds released multiplied by 100

metadata.description: Mid-Day Meal  (MDM) scheme is a flagship programme of the Government of India aiming at enhancing enrolment, retention and attendance and simultaneously improving nutritional levels among children upto class 8 studying in schools. Mid-Day Meal is served on all working days in the school. There is provision to provide MDM to schoold children in summer vacations in drought affected areas. MDM is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme, which is funded by both the Centre  and State governments based on the fund sharing aggreement.
metadata.name: Mid Day Meal (MDM)
metadata.source: Compiled by CBGA from the data provided in the minutes of the Programme Approval Board (PAB) meetings available at: http://mdm.nic.in/mdm_website/

indicator_01.description: Amount of balance reported under the scheme from the previous Financial Year (FY)
indicator_01.name: Opening Balance
indicator_01.note: As per the information provided in the scheme MIS. The negative sign in opening balance shows over expenditure reported in in previous FY

indicator_02.description: Total funds allocated for the scheme by the Central Government, which includes programme and admin. fund
indicator_02.name: Allocation of Central Share
indicator_02.note: As per the information provided in the scheme MIS

indicator_03.description: Total funds allocated for the scheme by the State Government, which includes programme and admin. fund
indicator_03.name: Allocation of State Share
indicator_03.note: As per the information provided in the scheme MIS

indicator_04.description: Total funds allocated for the scheme by both the Central and State Governments
indicator_04.name: Total Fund Allocation
indicator_04.note: As per the information provided in the scheme MIS

indicator_05.description: Funds released by the Central Government as Central Share for the Scheme
indicator_05.name: Release of Central Share
indicator_05.note: As per the information provided in the scheme MIS

indicator_06.description: Funds released by the State Government as State Share for the Scheme
indicator_06.name: Release of State Share
indicator_06.note: As per the information provided in the scheme MIS

indicator_07.description: It is the summation of funds Released by the Central and State Governments
indicator_07.name: Total Release of Fund
indicator_07.note: As per the information provided in the scheme MIS

indicator_08.description: Total Fund available is the summation of opening balance and fund released by both the Central and State governments
indicator_08.name: Total Fund Available

indicator_09.description: Total funds utilised reported for the scheme by the end of the financial year
indicator_09.name: Total Fund Utilisation
indicator_09.note: As per the information provided in the scheme MIS

indicator_10.description: It shows the extent of funds utilised out of the total funds available for the scheme
indicator_10.name: Extent of Fund Utilisation Against Total Fund Available
indicator_10.note: Extent of fund utilisation against total funds available is more than 100 per cent indicates fund utilisation is more than funds available. This has been computed by taking total funds utilised upon total funds available multiplied by 100

indicator_11.description: It shows the extent of funds utilised out of the total funds allocated for the scheme
indicator_11.name: Extent of Fund Utilisation Against Total Fund Allocation
indicator_11.note: The extent of fund utilisation against total funds allocated is more than 100 per cent indicates fund utilisation is more than funds allocated. This has been computed by taking total funds utilised upon total funds allocated for the scheme multiplied by 100

indicator_12.description: It shows the extent of funds utilised out of the total funds released.
indicator_12.name: Extent of Fund Utilisation Against Total Fund Released
indicator_12.note: Extent of fund utilisation against total funds released is more than 100 per cent indicates fund utilisation is more than funds released. This has been computed by taking total funds utilised upon total funds released for the scheme multiplied by 100

metadata.description: PMAY-G  is a flagship programme of the  Government of India. It is the biggest public housing programme in the country with a mission to alleviate poverty. The objective of the programme is to provide “Housing for All’’ by the year 2022. Under the scheme, the minimum size of the house is 25 sq.mt. with a hygienic cooking space. The scheme provides financial assistance for constructing a pucca houses for the rural poor. Beneficiaries are selected using housing deprivation parameters in the Socio-Economic and Caste Census (SECC), 2011, which is to be verified by the Gram Sabhas.
metadata.name: Pradhan Mantri Awaas Yojana-Grameen (PMAY-G)
metadata.source: Compiled by CBGA from the data provided in PMAY-MIS. Data extracted from the website on 12 Aug 2020. https://rhreporting.nic.in/netiay/FinancialProgressReport/Report_HighLevel_FinancialProgress.aspx

metadata.description: The Rashtriya Madhyamik Shiksha Abhiyan is a flagship scheme of Government of India, launched in March 2009, to enhance access to secondary education and improve its quality. The scheme aims at increasing universal access to secondary level education and is based on three-pronged strategies for improving access, equity and quality.
metadata.name: Rashtriya Madhyamik Shiksha Abhiyan (RMSA)
metadata.source: Compiled by CBGA from the information received from RTI application and data provided in a Lok Sabha Unstarred Question

metadata.description: Swachh Bharat Mission- Gramin (SBM-G) was launched in October 2014. The mission was implemented as nation-wide campaign/Janandolan which aimed at eliminating open defecation in rural areas during the period 2014 to 2019 through mass scale behavioural change, construction of household-owned and community-owned toilets and establishing mechanisms for monitoring toilet construction and usage.
metadata.name: Swachh Bharat Mission - Gramin (SBM-G)
metadata.source: Compiled by CBGA based on the responses received under RTI

indicator_01.description: Total funds allocated as per the budget approved for the scheme
indicator_01.name: Funds Allocated
indicator_01.note: As per the information provided in the financial report of the scheme

indicator_02.description: Total funds released by the Government of India (as central share) based on the fund sharing agreement on the scheme
indicator_02.name: Funds Released
indicator_02.note: Funds released out of approved allocation after adjusting unspent balances / excess expenditure incurred by the States/UTs in the previous financial year

indicator_03.description: Total funds utilised under  various components  of the scheme
indicator_03.name: Funds Utilised
indicator_03.note: Total funds utilised reports only the Government of India share and does not include the State's share under the scheme

indicator_04.note: Unspent balance reports only Government of India and does not include the State's share under the scheme

indicator_06.name: Extent of Funds Utilised against Total Funds Released
indicator_06.note: This has been computed by taking total funds utilised upon total funds released multiplied by 100

metadata.description: The RKVY was launched in 2007 to promote holistic development of agriculture and allied sectors via incentivising states to promote public investment, create infrastructure and additional income generating activities. From 2017 onwards the scheme was revamped and renamed as Rashtriya Krishi Vikas Yojana - Remunerative Approaches for Agriculture and Allied Sector Rejuvenation (RKVY-RAFTAAR). The scheme started as Additional Central Assistance to States, but subsequently converted into a centrally sponsored scheme.
metadata.name: Rashtriya Krishi Vikas Yojana (RKVY)
metadata.source: Compiled by CBGA from the data provided in RKVY-Financial report and as per the responses received under RTI for  the FYs 2016-17 and 2019-20

indicator_01.description: This is the total amount of funds approved for various projects under the scheme
indicator_01.name: Funds Approved
indicator_01.note: As per the information provided in Lok Sabha unstarred question

indicator_02.description: Total funds released from Government of India for various projects under the scheme
indicator_02.name: Funds Released
indicator_02.note: As per the response received under RTI

indicator_03.description: This indicates the total amount of funds utilised under the scheme. Please note that the total funds utilised denotes here  only the Government of India's share for the scheme and does not include the State's share
indicator_03.name: Funds Utilised
indicator_03.note: As per the response received under RTI

indicator_04.description: It shows the extent of funds utilised out of the total funds approved for the scheme
indicator_04.name: Extent of Funds Utilised against Total Funds Approved
indicator_04.note: This has been computed by taking Total Funds Utilised upon Total Funds Approved multiplied by 100

indicator_05.description: It shows the extent of funds utilised out of the total funds released under the scheme from Government of India
indicator_05.name: Extent of Funds Utilised against Total Funds Released
indicator_05.note: This has been computed by taking Total Funds Utilised upon Total Funds Released multiplied by 100

metadata.description: Blue Revolution was launched in the year 2014 by restructuring the existing schemes. This scheme includes erstwhile schemes like Integrated Development and Management of Fisheries and Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana. The main objective of the scheme is to develop, manage, and promote fisheries to double the farmers’ income. The scheme aims at bringing revolution through sustainable, responsible and holistic development of fisheries sector in India including welfare of fishermen. The scheme is implemented in all the States and Union Territories of India.
metadata.name: Blue Revolution
metadata.source: Compiled by CBGA from the data provided in Lok Sabha unstarred question and responses received under RTI

indicator_02.description: Total funds utilised in the scheme (only central share)
indicator_02.name: Total Funds Utilised
indicator_02.note: Data compiled as per the response received under RTI

indicator_03.description: The amount that remains unspent out of the funds released
indicator_03.name: Unspent Balance
indicator_03.note: Data compiled as per the response received under RTI

indicator_04.description: It shows the extent of funds utilised out of the total funds released in percentage terms
indicator_04.name: Extent of Funds Utilised against Total Funds Released
indicator_04.note: This has been computed by taking total funds utilised upon total funds released multiplied by 100

metadata.description: The scheme OSC is intended to support women affected by violence in private & public spaces, within the family, community and at the workplace. It is being implemented since 1st April 2015 under the Ministry of Women and Child Development. In addition to the 36 centres in first phase 150 centres were taken up in the 2nd phase (2016-17). It is implemented by States/UTs through the Nirbhaya Fund (Nirbhaya Fund is a non-lapsable corpus fund for safety and security of women). The scheme aims to facilitate emergency and non-emergency acess to a range of services including medical, legal, psychological and counseling supoort under one roof.
metadata.name: One Stop Centre (OSC)
metadata.source: Compiled by CBGA from the responses received under RTI

indicator_01.description: This indicates total funds released under the scheme as central share
indicator_01.name: Total Funds Released
indicator_01.note: As per the information provided in the sanction orders of Poshan Abhiyaan

indicator_02.description: This indicates total funds utilised reported under the scheme out of central share
indicator_02.name: Total Funds Utilised
indicator_02.note: As per the response received under RTI

indicator_03.description: It shows the percentage  of funds utilised out of the total funds released (Central share only)
indicator_03.name: Extent of Funds Utilised against Total Funds Released
indicator_03.note: This has been computed by dividing Total Funds Utilised by Total Funds Released multiplied by 100

metadata.description: Poshan Abhiyaan, earlier known as the National Nutrition Mission (NNM), was launched in March 2018 to reduce malnutrition in India in a phased manner. The scheme focuses on reducing malnutrition among children aged 0-6 years, adolescent girls, and pregnant and lactating women. This is to be achieved through a three-year, time-bound life-cycle approach. The scheme involves the use of technology, convergence, behavioral change, training and capacity building.
metadata.name: Poshan Abhiyaan (NNM)
metadata.source: Compiled by CBGA from the sanction orders of Poshan Abhiyaan (http://icds-wcd.nic.in/nnm/home.htm) and responses received under RTI

indicator_01.description: Budget approved is the same as the Estimated Outlay for the scheme
indicator_01.name: Budget Approved
indicator_01.note: Data compiled from the RTI response

indicator_02.description: Funds released from the Central Government is the Central Government's share for the scheme
indicator_02.name: Fund Released from the Central Government
indicator_02.note: Data compiled from the RTI response as well as from Annual Audited Reports of the respective States / UTs for the scheme

indicator_03.description: This includes the funds released by the States / UTs plus the interest money accrued on the funds available in the designated accounts
indicator_03.name: Fund Released from the States / UTs
indicator_03.note: Compiled from the RTI response as well as from Annual Audited Reports of the respective States / UTs for the scheme

indicator_04.description: Total funds released by both the Central and State governments for the scheme during the financial year
indicator_04.name: Total Fund Released (Both Central and States Share)
indicator_04.note: This is the sum of the funds released by both the Central and State governments for the scheme during the financial year

indicator_05.description: This shows the total amount of expenditure reported by the States / UTs (including States share)
indicator_05.name: Expenditure Incurred by the States / UTs
indicator_05.note: Compiled as per the information available in the Parliamentary Question Nos:150 for FYs 2015-16 & 2016-17 and responses received from the RTI for FY 2017-18

indicator_06.description: This shows total unspent amount available with the States / UTs
indicator_06.name: Unspent Balance
indicator_06.note: Compiled from the data received from the RTI response. Figures with a negative sign indicates over-spending reported by States / UTs

indicator_07.description: It shows the extent of funds released against the total estimated outlay (budget approved) for the scheme
indicator_07.name: Extent of Funds Released against Budget Approved
indicator_07.note: This has been computed by taking Total Funds Released upon the Total Budget Approved multiplied by 100

indicator_08.description: It shows the extent of funds utilised against the total estimated outlay (budget approved) for the scheme
indicator_08.name: Extent of Funds Utilised against Budget Approved
indicator_08.note: This has been computed by taking Total Funds Utilised upon the Total Budget Approved multiplied by 100

metadata.description: SSA is Government of India's flagship programme. The scheme aims to provide free and compulsory elementary education to all children in the 6 to 14 age group and seeks to provide quality elementary education, including life skills. The scheme has a special focus on girls education and children with special needs.
metadata.name: Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan (SSA)
metadata.source: Compiled by CBGA from the data available at various sources. These are: https://seshagun.gov.in/audit-report?field_financial_year_target_id=37&field_states_target_id=All; https://documents.worldbank.org/en/publication/documents-reports/documentlist?qterm=P144447

indicator_01.description: Total funds released by the Government of India (as central share) based on the fund sharing agreement of the scheme
indicator_01.name: Funds Released
indicator_01.note: Funds released out of approved allocation

indicator_02.description: Total funds utilised for various components under the scheme
indicator_02.name: Funds Utilised
indicator_02.note: Total funds utilised under the scheme reports Government of India's share only and does not include the State's share

indicator_03.description: Total funds remained unutilised under various components of the scheme
indicator_03.name: Unspent Balance
indicator_03.note: Total funds remained unutilised under the scheme reports Government of India's share only and does not include the State's share

indicator_04.description: It shows the extent of funds utilised out of the total funds released
indicator_04.name: Extent of Funds Utilised against Funds Released
indicator_04.note: This has been computed by dividing total funds utilised by total funds released multiplying by 100

metadata.description: Swachh Bharat Mission - Urban (SBM-U) was launched in October 2014. The scheme aims at making urban India free from open defecation and also seeks to achieve 100 per cent scientific management of municipal solid waste . SBM-U is implemented by the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs, Government of India. It is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme, and is funded by Centre as well as State governments, based on a fund sharing agreement.
metadata.name: Swachh Bharat Abhiyan - Urban (SBM-U)
metadata.source: Compiled by CBGA from the response received under RTI

indicator_01.description: This shows amount of funds released by the Government of India for the scheme
indicator_01.name: Funds Released
indicator_01.note: As per the data provided in the Lok Sabha unstarred question. Data for the Financial Year (FY) 2019-20 are based on the reply received under RTI

indicator_02.description: This indicates total amount of expenditure made during the FY, including states share
indicator_02.name: Funds Utilised
indicator_02.note: As per the data provided in the Lok Sabha unstarred question. Data for the Financial Year (FY) 2019-20 are based on the reply received under RTI

indicator_03.description: This indicates the funds that remained unspent during the FY, including States share
indicator_03.name: Unspent Balance
indicator_03.note: Compiled based on the information received under RTI

metadata.description: The Integrated Child Protection Scheme (ICPS) is a centrally sponsored scheme aimed at building a protective environment for children in difficult circumstances, as well as other vulnerable children, through Government-Civil Society Partnership. The primary purpose of the scheme is to create a central structure to provide oversight and standardization for pre-existing and evolving child protection schemes in India.
metadata.name: Integrated Child Protection Scheme (ICPS)
metadata.source: Compiled by CBGA from the information provided in Lok Sabha unstarred question and responses received under RTI

indicator_01.description: The amount proposed for the scheme consists of both the Central and States share
indicator_01.name: Budget Proposed by the States / UTs
indicator_01.note: The amount proposed by the States / UTs for the scheme is available in the Programme Implementation Plan (PIP) and Supplementary PIP of respective States and UTs

indicator_02.description: The amount approve consists of both the Central and States share
indicator_02.name: Budget Approved for the States / UTs
indicator_02.note: The information on amount approved for the States / UTs for the scheme collated from the Record of Proceedings (RoP) and Supplementary RoP documents of the respective states and UTs. The amount approved for the respective years as per approval of the National Programme Coordination Committee

indicator_03.description: Unspent Balance of the Central Fund available with the States and UTs by the end of the respective financial year
indicator_03.name: Opening Balance with the States / UTs
indicator_03.note: Figures having negative sign indicate more expenditure (negative balance with the states and UTs) and is provisional

indicator_04.description: This only includes Central Government Grant to the scheme and do not include states share
indicator_04.name: Release of Central Government Fund

indicator_05.description: Total expenditure includes expenditure against central release, state share and unspent balances under the scheme at the beginning of the year
indicator_05.name: Total Expenditure Reported (Including States Share)

indicator_06.description: Indicates how much funds approved for a state against the demand proposed under the scheme
indicator_06.name: Extent of Budget Approved Against Budget Proposed
indicator_06.note: This has been computed based on the data on the approved budget and proposed budget for the scheme for respective states and UTs

indicator_07.description: Indicates how much funds utilised by a state under the scheme against the funds approved
indicator_07.name: Extent of Funds Utilised Against Budget Approved
indicator_07.note: This has been computed based on the data on total funds utilised (which includes both central release and states share) against the approved budget for the scheme for respective states and UTs

indicator_08.description: Indicates how much funds utilised by a state under the scheme against the funds proposed
indicator_08.name: Extent of Funds Utilised Against Budget Proposed
indicator_08.note: This has been computed based on the data on total funds utilised (which includes both central release and states share) against the proposed budget for the scheme for respective states and UTs

metadata.description: The scheme envisages achievement of universal access to equitable, affordable and quality health care services that are accountable and responsive to people’s needs. The scheme has two sub-missions, the National Rural Health Mission (NRHM) and the National Urban Health Mission (NUHM). The main programmatic components of the scheme include Health System Strengthening, Reproductive-Maternal- Neonatal-Child and Adolescent Health (RMNCH+A), and Communicable and Non-Communicable Diseases
metadata.name: National Health Mission (NHM)
metadata.source: Compiled by CBGA from the data available at https://nhm.gov.in/; -a programmatic document of the Scheme and reply received from RTI application
